The Best Western is newly remodeled though, so given identical rates, I would pick the Best Western (and it has tennis courts). Fun trip, thanks Kona Kai !

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on Kona Kai”
Reviews.Author: traveller7363
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a one week long nightmare at the so-called Kona Kai Resort and Spa. My co-workers and I were there for a radiology conference that was held at the resort and felt it was best to stay on premises as transportation was limited and daily parking was expensive. Looking back now, I would have stayed off-site. I went to a radiology meeting there, and arrived few days early and the hotel was disappointing to say the least. There were over 250 attendees at the meeting with a general consensus that the facility was less than adequate. Many people only tolerated an unacceptable situation, others changed rooms, others stayed out of their hotel rooms for as long as possible and yet others simply moved out of the Kona Kai. I reserved at this particular hotel from the radiology association website and now I realize that the links to the Kona Kai Resort website have been grossly photoshopped, doctored, embellished and glorified! The Kona Kai at Shelter Pointe in San Diego, CA is rated 3.9 and average for the area by Hotels.com. This is a FAULTY rating as it does not even come close to the description and photos in on Hotels.com. The lobby was spartan, the furniture in the lobby was worn and needed replacement or reupholstering. Upon entering the hallway to my room, it was obvious I were staying in a sub-standard motel that had no pretense of being a three star hotel much less a resort. There were stains on the carpet, food trays left in the hallways, dust hanging from the ventilation grates, scuffs along the walls of the hallway and doors to the rooms. I was in a room and it was not worth anything close to what they charged. The Hotels.com and AAA rate listed for the room is around $89 and yet they charged $189 in November - off season. My room was not only dated, the last time it had been renovated was probably years ago, but it had a strong musty and mildew odor. The air conditioner was antiquated and turning it on only added to the moldy and mildew odor. The room is dark and poorly lit, only a light by the door and two lamps beside the bed. Opening the cheap aluminum sliding doors leading to the courtyard-pool area to get rid of the foul musty smell, only reconfirmed what I was seeing. The flimsy screen door latch looked as though it could be easily opened from the outside even when locked. Also the curtains covering the door to the patio were also stained and torn. The wall papered walls in the room had stains running up it and was dusty. I don't think anyone has cleaned it in quite some time. The carpeting in the room had numerous stains on it and worst of all, the bed sheets were stained. The furniture in the room was old and worn, small TV, few cable stations. The bath linens were no better, having yellow and dark stains on towels. The bathroom looked as though it had received only a cursory cleaning with soap scum evident on the shower stall tiles and hairs on the shower floor. The bathroom had no vanity area or counter space at all even though this was a handicapped room. The coffee pot was placed on a cheap water damaged wooden stand next to the bathroom sink so that it could be plugged into the razor outlet. All the other electrical outlets in the room were removed except for one in the small corner between the air conditioning unit and closet/ TV armoire. This single electrical outlet is not even accessible for the handicapped person. It looks like that at one point were electrical outlets in the room but all the convenience electrical plugs for the computer by both the desk and night stands have been removed. There is a table on the patio with two chairs but it has not been cleaned for a while. There were cigarette butts all over the rocks providing ground cover for the shrubs. My room was no different in lack of maintenance than that of my colleagues attending the meeting. Many rooms had foul odors which were permeating clothing and you could smell in the person's clothes at the meeting. The drains in the showers, bathtubs and sinks did not drain properly resulting in standing in water during a shower. In my room the shower drain was backing up when showering. This problem must have persisted for some time as the cheap particle board stand for the coffee machine in the bathroom had been soaked in water enough to cause swelling of the wood and loss of paint on the surface. The walls are so thin, you can expect to be awakened when the staff push their service carts down the hallway each morning at 6 a.m. Also, the housekeeping staff was very loud in the morning -- they would be outside in the corridors calling down the halls to one another. I could hear the conversations in the hallway with the room door closed. You can also hear creaking of floor above every morning from the people walking around. The worst part was the outside door slamming very loudly each time someone left or came into the building. Very poor room service. Rooms were not cleaned promptly. Often they were still cleaning at 2 p.m. There were a lot of room service trays left outside doors all the time and the food trays would be left there for several days. Overpriced on-premise restaurant. Cockroaches were seen in the dining area by more than colleague so I decided I would eat out even though it is quite a walk. The Kona Kai does offer a shuttle service to local restaurants but it is a Kia minivan that can only accommodate 6 passengers. The wait for a shuttle out to a nearby restaurant was 2 hours. Shuttles to the airport in the same minivan. Makes for long waits when you are at meeting with over 250 people. I discovered several restaurants which were much better than that offered by the Kona Kai- i.e.; Blue Wave in the Best Western Hotel next door, Fiddlers Green (steaks), Brigantine (good seafood), Point Loma Seafood and Juice It Up (smoothies and panini). Most of the restaraunts are a fair walk away (about 1 mile) so bring comfortable walking shoes except the Blue Wave which is about 5 minute walk. Expect to be nickeled and dimed to death... Charge for the fitness center!!!! $10.00/day Charge for computer and printer use!!! $.35 per minute on old antiquated computers Charge for the parking!!!! $10 or $15/day Charge for extra chair in room!!! All in all VERY disappointing. It was a disastrous eight nights in the hotel and although I tried to talk with reception staff, there was great difference. I felt a little hospitality. I was referred to the hotel manager who conveniently was never available when I was at the reception desk. There are three other hotels next door that are much better. Best Western next door at only $95 per night, and the Bay Club. Keep on looking, pass on the Kona Kai. The rooms are run down and the staff were less than enthusiastic about helping. Save your money and heed this advice and the other negative reviews, as they are the TRUTH not the pictures you see on the Kona Kai website or Hotels.com. The positive reviews must be from relatives of employees or paid evaluators. Do NOT waste your $$ here!!”

Reviews.Title: “worst place I have ever stayed in USA”
Reviews.Author: JAYasanke
Reviews.Content: I have been a business traveller for 10 years in US. This the worst place I have ever stayed in the in he entire united states. They charge you for using the gym, charge you for have asking for extra chairs in the room. The worst costumer service I have ever had entire entire united state. Unless you are a sucker for the topography I woiuld recommed this place to my worst enemy

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view with terrible room”
Reviews.Author: sarihui
Reviews.Content: The room carpet was not clean. When I walked , made the furniture that bad quality shaking and noise. The place for basin, with coffee maker and to charge your mobile phone was too small. But it has beautiful view. For the breakfast , they serve in some menu. You should pay for the juice and toast. But the food was nice. Don't miss the Belgium waffle. They will offer you what juice you want to and then give you the menu which show the price for juice. The swimming pool is attractive. The front desk staff forgot to smile. :( . I am dust allergy.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: Otis4
Reviews.Content: Hotel definately needs a face lift! Carpets and paint are shabby. Bathroom tub is stained. Beds are hard. Shower head only trickles water. The phone in the room didn't work. I reported the last two items to the front desk - but no one ever came to fix them. $15 a day parking is steep! Peaceful and beautiful location.

Reviews.Title: “Love the property and location!”
Reviews.Author: slll
Reviews.Content: I was a little scared when I checked into the hotel because of the poor housekeeping. When I called the Front Desk to let them know I found trash under the beds and a dirty bathroom, Patrice immediately came to our room with additional keys to provide us with options. Unfortunately, it quickly became apparent that housekeeping did a very poor job in all of the rooms. So, I opted to stay where I was. A Gentleman did come to the room to help me clean up a bit...he cleaned up some of the urine off of the toilet, but I was shocked when he told me couldn't pick up anymore trash b/c if he picked up another piece than he would just drop something else. This was the only bad experience. The hotel itself is WONDERFUL! Just make sure you take Clorox wipes with you to give the room a once over upon arrival!

Reviews.Title: “Great anniversary Trip to Kona Kai”
Reviews.Author: ginaduyen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to celebrate our anniversary in San Diego and we chose the Kona Kai resort because we heard great thing about the location. We really love the hotel, we had a room with patio looking out to the bay with fabulous view. The room was a little small but but was clean and very comfortable, the Staff was very attentive. We had a great Luau celebration on Friday 9/3/10 with my niece and her boyfriend (they also stayed at the hotel). Our booking came with breakfast so we ate breakfast the restaurant, which has great view of the marina. Overall we like the Kona Kai hotel alot and will come back. I think the hotel should be a four star instead of 3. Gina

Reviews.Title: “What a relaxing experience!”
Reviews.Author: SkipJacovino
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to stay at the Kona Kai Resort over the Labor Day weekend with our 7 year old daughter. We had made plans to watch the Hawaiian Luau show that Kona Kai runs on Fridays in the summer and then stay the balance of the weekend. First off, checking in and parking were a breeze and very efficient. When I entered the lobby to check in, the first thing I noticed was the warm Spanish Villa styled lobby area. The huge fireplace, cushy chairs and couches, and warm tones immediately put me in a good mood. We were greeted by the manager Dennis Vinegas who assured us that our stay would be memorable (and he was right). Our bellman, then helped us to our room and took care of our baggage...he was so fast that he actually beat us to our room (I still don;t know how he did it!). When we got to our room, we noticed that we had a great view of the main courtyard and pool, as well as the marina (and a nice balcony to take it all in)...what a specatacular view. After settling in , we saw the Luau/Hula show which was fantastic...the food was delcious, in particular the Kahlua Pork and the Lomi Lomi Salmon..I have to admit I went back for seconds and thirds! The show was very nice, with children and adult perfomers and even two fire dancers...The next day,(Saturday) we awoke and had breakfast in the main dining room. Again, it was a very comforting place, with it's vaulted turret ceiling and beautiful views of the Shelter Island Marina...and the food was plentiful and freshly prepared..and most importantly, served efficiently and courteously. The wait and bus staff was qucik to cater to our every need. Later, we went to hang out at the pool and jacuzzi and spent the bulk of the day just lounging and relaxing. The hotel has a pool cocktail/food server and we definitely took advantage of their services. The Calamari and the Mojitos are a must-try.by the pool. We had dinner offsite that night (another story which is not so nice...I won't mention the place). But we made it back in time for a nice evening soak in the jacuzzi and for our daughter to play on the playground adjacent to the pool before heading to bed. Thewre were other families in that area with a fire going in the firepit on site which gave the evening a real "clambake" celebratory feel...a very nice night. On Sunday, we again had breakfast in the dining room (we ate breakfast there every morning)...then did some sight-seening down by Seaport Village (a short drive away)...it was warm outside though, and we found ourselves back at the pool again by early afternoon for more swimming, mojitos and calamari! The whole experience of this place was perfect for us...the hotel has so many areas where people can gather and play cards, visit with family etc.(there were many family reunions and a few weddings that weekend...but there was always plenty of space on the hotel grounds to do your own thing)....The decor and service at every level invited you to relax, and enjoy...and that is really what you want out of a mini-vacation...the bottomline on our trip is that we intend to return and make more family memories very soon. Our thanks to Dennis and staff for a great and memorable labor Day weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: nenateeth
Reviews.Content: We live in San Diego and love doing short little vacations in our home town! The Hotel Operations Manager Dennis Vinegas made sure we were well taken care with the room we wanted which overlooked pool and Marina. Staff was very nice to us and made sure we had everything we needed. We enjoyed the food and I might say the Luau was the best part of our stay! We can't wait to come back and visit! Kona Kai Resort

Reviews.Title: “outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: norcalgirls
Reviews.Content: My 25-year old daughter and I spent a lovely 2 nights at this beautiful, relaxing hotel. The staff was very pleasant. We had AAA, so we received 2 complimentary breakfasts and free parking each day. The food was delicious. The facility and rooms were clean. The property was very well kept up and very quiet. I would stay here again and would reccommed it anyone who wants a relaxing visit with a wonderful view of sail boats. I was able to run each morning while looking at boats and the variety of art and historical information along the path. Also, very affordable, during the week.

Reviews.Title: “What a let down”
Reviews.Author: Theoneandonlydlr
Reviews.Content: We had been traveliing around California for two and half weeks and we were all looking forward to staying in one place for a few nights, we booked into the Kona Kai as it seemed to tick the boxes. Not cheap but we'd wanted somewhere nice to stay for our last leg in California, Pool Beach Gym Bed & Breakfast included. Well our room was onto the beach but it is a manmade beach which leads to the Harbour which I didn't appreciate, this aside our first night was spent listening to a group of teenagers hanging out on the beach followed by the constant echo of doors slamming into the night. To be fair the staff did say that we could move rooms but as the majority of rooms are in a similar position and we'd now unpacked there seemed little point. The included breakfast was for two only, apparently children don't need to eat in the USA and the cost of additional breakfast orders were ridiculous. We opted to use our vouchers for all of us then head to Dennys for the remaining mornings. The other nasty surprise (should have checked trip advisor first) was the $15 a night parking fee. This was not mentioned on our booking confirmation and so we were totally unaware of it. Also the addtional cost to use the gym, had the staff been a little more pleasant at the time of check in we would have thought 'oh well our mistake' but the arrogance of the check in clerks especially when i mentioned about the parking and the breakfast costs, immediately made me wish to spend as little money in this hotel as possible. I cannot therefore tell you about the restaurant because we ate out every night. The hotel views are nice if you like looking at other peoples boats, otherwise go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Should be one star hotel”
Reviews.Author: AMPSTCA
Reviews.Content: I requested a king size bed but they only had a double left when I checked in. The room has old furniture and old TV. The view from the hotel is just parked cars. My room is one the first floor and you hear door banging everywhere. You have to pay $15 for parking your car, just like downtown hotels. Very disappointed with my stay here. Cannot wait to get the hell out.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Olvic
Reviews.Content: Just want to add couple more words to the previous review. Have some days ago returned from San Diego. The hotel is in very good place. All rooms really have or bay view or marina view. Decent show is spent on Fridays. A pure pool, but almost every day there were many children. The biggest lack was the room and shower, including restroom aria. The room looks like was not updated for the last 100 years. And this is true. Everything was in below average condition. NO screen on the balcony door, so you have to keep the door close and run AC (which was very noise like the most old window AC) or to buy a screen from the nearest Home Depot ant tape it every night. Parking is not free, but wireless internet was working fine. If you can fix all these issues I can easily give five stars to this hotel. That is why I do not recommend this hotel now.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: suzy31
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last 4 nights of our Honeymoon, Let me start with the good things, The views from the hotel are outstanding either on the marina side or the harbour, it has a really well equiped gym with views on to the Marina. It's a very relaxing location of stunning beauty. Now for the bad things the Hotel was built in 1962 and really needs to be re-furbished, it apparently was suppose to happen last year but due to finances not being available it didn't happen. The rooms are shabby and tired with dated bathrooms the rooms are not cleaned that well but that is also to do with it being all so old, I did have a hairslide and some cereal by my bed when we checked in, the room viewed our car on the carpark, road, and then harbour view as this was the last 4 days of our honeymoon we wanted this to be so special, before unpacking we complained and were given a marine view room, it was shabby but had a feeling that all the rooms were the same. After one day we realised that the room was so dark it was depressing to be in, my partner went to see the Manager, who was unhelpful, aggressive and unreasonable saying that they had tried to please us but there was no pleasing us. As my partner is a good communicator he managed to turn this around and explain that we still weren't happy and she needed to put that right, she finally agreed. We got the best room / suite in the hotel. It was huge with a lounge kitchenette, 2 bathrooms, large bedroom but again decor very tired, out dated bathroom, but it was a light room, so success. another moan $10 dollars to use the gym!!!! that means another $80 dollars on our bill if we used it daily. another moan Free breakfast, yes but you have very little choice if you dont want un-healthy waffles, pancakes etc. $2.75 for toast $2.95 glass of orange juice, just madness!! why not do a buffett style it's so disorganised. Location - great if you want peace and quiet, but you do need a car, it costs $24 to get a taxi to gaslamp district which can make it an expensive night out. The concierge guy is really helpful, and does run a bus to the airport, if it's convenient he will drop you at the airport where you can catch a bus in, it's a lot cheaper, but not the nicest of experiences and you would still need to get a taxi return. If you really want to be staying on shelter Island check out the Best Western, Humphries,or Blue Wave they are all just a bit further along the island, but if your a party nightlife person, it's not the right location. Out of the 5 hotels we stayed in on our honeymoon this was the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Rate, So peaceful”
Reviews.Author: DetroitGal
Reviews.Content: The manager, Dennis, made sure my family and I received a super rate over July 4th! Customer service was great! When a manager, like Dennis, goes out of his way to make us happy, it shows he appreciates us choosing his hotel. When I feel like a valued customer at any place, I will visit the establishment more than others.. Great view of the Harbor and the Bay. So peaceful at the end of the island, which made the trip so relaxing. Clean rooms, and comfy beds made the trip even better. We will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Kona Kai Resort Hotel - superb views, tired hotel - not worth the money....”
Reviews.Author: bryble
Reviews.Content: Greeted by a sour faced head receptionist who couldn't dispose of us quickly enough. Concierge dumped our cases at the door of 2nd floor room (no lift) and vanished. Room had damp smell and insect screen was hanging off the frame. Marina view of the boats from room was superb so we decided to stay. Meanwhile car park at $15 gave us a pass but each time we went in or out we had to stamp in give name, room number etc - bit of a pain and not worth having the pass. Also you could park for free just across the road in public park. 'Free breakfast' was not free as 1 orange juice and 2 roundsof toast added almost $12 to our 'free' breakfast. Staff not very pleasant. Everything a problem and 'manager not available' to talk to so we checked out and stayed at the Best Western just up the road. Same view. Lovely staff. Less $$. Don't rush to stay at the Kona Kai. Shoot yourself in the foot - less painful.

Reviews.Title: “Rude desk staff - Would NOT stay again”
Reviews.Author: azkym
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review on Travelocity that surprisingly did NOT show up. Hmmmm... We arrived around 12:30 pm on Sunday and was told to check back in 45 min for our rooms. No problem. Went to their dining room and had lunch, came back - still no room. The staff stated that we needed to come back in another hour as check in wasn't until 4 pm and we were "Early". ??? What? Unfortunatley, we did not have a vehicle, and unbeknownst to us buses and shuttles are not allowed on the island in order to control traffic. We were basically stuck to hang out in the lobby. We had my older mother and two children who were very tired and just wanted to get to our rooms. To make a long story short, they did not have our rooms until 4 pm. 4 hours later!! Other guests continued to come in and get their rooms. No apology other than they continued to say we checked in too early!! We were disgusted with the Reservation Mgr, as she never apologized and when we questioned why other guests that were coming in AFTER we were, she once again spouted "check in isn't until 4 pm". In addition I had called a month prior to our visit and requested that we were women traveling alone with our senior mother and asked that we be placed close together. We got there and of course this was not the case. They were unable to accomodate us with this small request as well. The rooms are dated and the accomodations are limited. If you do not have a vehicle I would not recommend this location. Let's be honest...I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE.

Reviews.Title: “loved the location”
Reviews.Author: 123thomas
Reviews.Content: Picked Kona Kai after researching for weeks, because of the price, reviews, & pictures. I was looking for a quite, peaceful, good location with pretty surroundings and I got it. The room was nice, the location was great, the grounds were very nice. The bay is on one side, marina on the other. Our balcony faced the marina which we loved. Is it a 5 star resort, No. But it is a very nice, comfortable, relaxing resort, without the 5 star price tag. We stayed 5 nights, and after sightseeing each day, we were so glad we picked Kona Kai to come back "home" to on Shelter Island.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel overlooking the water!”
Reviews.Author: verduram
Reviews.Content: Me and one of my friends got set up at the Kona Kai when our flight back to Detroit was cancelled. Trudi was working at the front desk and was so nice and accomodating. She gave us an awesome room with views of the water. The room was really cute and had a beach theme. We only got to stay for one night, but I would have loved to stay longer. If I'm ever back in San Diego I will definitely be booking a room there. Thanks again for being so awesome Trudi!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location!”
Reviews.Author: JosimarsGirl
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent!! Trudy,who was the desk clerk on the evening we checked in was extremely friendly and worked quickly and efficiently to get our room when there was a slight issue with our reservation. The room was not quite what I expected, however, it was clean and the view was amazing. Location is also convenient for those tourists unfamiliar with California as attractions are close by. Again, service was outstanding and the view breathtaking. Would definitely recommend to friends!!

Reviews.Title: “I think the Kona Kai is awesome.”
Reviews.Author: clk55sd
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my Mom there and it was so peaceful. The harbor is nice, the pool is great and I had such a good experience with Trudi who was like my tour guide anytime I needed to know where I should go she was happy to explain the city to me. Stay there I totally think it was a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Trudy was great”
Reviews.Author: Travelers92108
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of meetingTrudy, who checked me in at the hotel and she provided excellent service. Not only was my stay at the hotel enjoyable, it was refreshing to have someone at the front desk who was concerned about my stay and was willing to answer all of my questions and make suggestions to assist me. Great job Trudy, I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely want to come back!”
Reviews.Author: Kat095
Reviews.Content: The Kona Kai Resort was a perfect setting for us. It had everything that we needed...our room was overlooking the pool and the bay and we had some relaxing moments hanging out on the balcony. We were given breakfast coupons and was very pleased with the quality and quantity of food. Although you only had 5 or 6 main menu selections to choose from, it included all the breakfast items you could want. The frittata with asparagus was the best! I would highly recommend the bike rental. We spent 2 hours one day on a bike rental and biked around San Diego along the water and got close to downtown. The location of the hotel is great! The grounds were kept up well and everything was clean. When we come back to San Diego, we will definitely check out Kona Kai again!

Reviews.Title: “Second time maybe the last...”
Reviews.Author: Pepperdee
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here once before 2 years ago. We loved it. The weather was a little more cooperative last time, but that's not the problem. First up we really resented the new parking restrictions along the road which force you to pay for parking the hotel lot or be towed. $15 a day!!!! Outrageous. I bet when the signs went up the hotel smacked their chops and went 'cha ching'. Also, the dog fee. Gone Waaaaaay up. We don't mind paying a fee for the privilege but its outrageous now. I felt like we maybe could have booked her her own room... If you want to workout? You have to pay extra for that too. The room was not so great. They put us in a Handicapped room for some bizarre reason. Neither of us are. This meant the bathroom was large, but had NO COUNTER. The cleanliness of the room bothered me. The wall papered feature wall in the bathroom (alongside the toilet/basin...the one with no counter) reflected in the light a host of stains running up it. I don't think anyone has run a cloth over it in quite some time...yeeeck. Also the curtains covering the door to the balcony...aside from looking rather sad and old, were also stained with...something...not too sure what...blood? wine? ketchup? double yeeeck! We had the room service breakfast. Very nice. Put our tray in the hall for pickup when we left that morning...the tray remained in the hall through the whole next day - still there when we left. We really like this place. The views, the marina, the bay on the other side. You do feel like you're on a real vacation there. We like that its dog friendly. But its obviously going downhill. In these economic times, STOP NICKEL AND DIMING US! We probably wont come back.

Reviews.Title: “Not living up to its potential”
Reviews.Author: JDL12424
Reviews.Content: We were at the Kona Kai for my son’s wedding. We had arrived early along with several other members of our group, it was just past noon and check-in is at 4:00 PM. We were told our rooms would be ready in an hour so we walked back down the island to find lunch. Returning at 2:00 Rooms were ready, except for mine which seemed to take an extra hour and was still missing some of the normal niceties like coffee and toilet paper. On the positive side the front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. They also seemed to have the ability to reduce or in some cases eliminate the advertised $15.00 parking fee for those who had rental cars. There are four resorts on Shelter Island. The Kona Kai is the last one in the line maintaining what I would see as the prime location. During the weekend we walked along the island many times and saw the maintenance and landscaping work being performed at the other resorts, especially the Bay Club. I hope the Kona Kai begins their projects soon. The resort is beautiful, but it has the potential to be so much better. Neglect is a harsh word though ignored is descriptive of their grounds, the decorative vegetation appeared to be attempting self-sufficiency. We had rooms on the ground floor, our patios opened onto the grassy area by the pool. The building was bordered by Bird of Paradise bushes, always a fascination to those from the northeast, these however needed some attention. Fortunately the bed area had small stepping stones as a walkway by each door that allowed you to walk through the mud and water caused by excessive irrigation. My daughter’s room was at the low end of the line and the irrigation combined with the drain from the ice machine formed a moat in front, a constant source of enjoyment for my three year old grandson and his mother’s dismay. In general the landscaping needs work. It has promise but has not had attention in a long time. The interiors of the hotel were clean and in good repair but seemed to be in need of something. I do not know the age of the Kona Kai but it gives the impression of an old resort that needs some TLC. Overall our stay was pleasant. Maid service was sufficient, although not efficient. Perhaps in keeping with the tropical theme the staff worked on “island time”. Our group for the wedding numbered about 80, all from out of the area, and the majority stayed at the Kona Kai. Most of us found that the dining options at the Kona Kai restaurant were a bit expensive for our tastes. I only ate one meal in the restaurant, breakfast on the last morning and while the meal was very good the cost exceeded what I would normally budget. Fortunately there are other options off premises, some within a pleasant walk. The only truly negative aspect of our stay occurred on Sunday evening. We had closed down the wedding reception and had gathered in a few groups, in rooms and by the pool, as we had done on the two previous evenings without issue. Obviously a new night security guard was in place this evening and recognizing the possibility of a noisy gathering he took interest. I fully understand his job and the responsibilities he has to the facility and its guests, however he needs training in the art of tact and diplomacy. His confrontational, disrespectful and threatening initial approach caused to escalate a non-existing situation. Fortunately a compromise was reached; we were given an area to continue our conversations and celebrations and even assisted with some of the amenities, the evening continued without incident. When I return to the San Diego area I probably will not choose to stay at the Kona Kai. It is a beautiful location and a nice facility but is far from its potential.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected...”
Reviews.Author: TitaNui
Reviews.Content: I wanted so badly to REALLY like this resort! It is away from the hustle and bustle of downtown and next to the marina and bay. Yahooo!!! 4 days and 3 nights next to the water! Even with a parking fee of $15/day, it seemed like a deal. Check-in was a little tricky since my request for either a 1st floor room or an elevator up to other floors was overlooked. Room 140 appeared to be perfect - parking close to the room, a lanai looking at the Marina and close to the main building and restaurant. Upon entering the room, we noticed a musty smell. It's fairly common for waterfront hotel rooms, so we chalked it up to the hotel's location. As time went on, we noticed another scent. There was a urine smell coming from the carpet next to the desk and door to the lanai. It was so unexpected, that I couldn't believe it! I actually got on my hands and knees to sniff the carpet to make sure of what I was smelling and where it was coming from. Yuck! Looks like someone snuck a pet into the room. Housekeeping can't notice it cuz they open both the lanai door and room door for ventilation when they clean. The lanai door is glass and covered with a fabric curtain tacked down with rods at top and bottom to the door. It isn't easily removed - I tried. The glass-side of the curtain is white (sorta) and covered with mildew. Maybe that's where the musty smell comes from. Daily housekeeping surely can't address it since they can't even access the glass from the inside of the room. Daily housekeeping was done well and with diligence. The housekeeping staff is professional and friendly. The grounds are well-maintained and the healthy plants, trees, and shrubs add to the resort's appearance. The breakfast that is included with the breakfast plan is more than adequate. There are 5 or 6 breakfast options (no substitutions). Additions are very pricey, so avoid them. Wait staff is helpful, though not overly-attentive. Check-out was easy and pleasant. Trudi assisted in every way possible. When she asked if we enjoyed our stay, I mentioned the smells in the room and the mildew on the door. She apologized profusely, made notes on the computer and asked if I would fill out a customer card. She quickly offered to "comp" our parking fees for the stay! She reminded us to notify the front desk of these types of problems in the future as we notice them and not wait until we check out. Her attitude and assistance will make us consider coming back. Maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Kona Kai!”
Reviews.Author: evans7
Reviews.Content: Changed to this hotel at the last minute and are so glad we did! The area is beautiful and peaceful! Our room was very clean, comfortable, and had a spectacular view of the Bay. Staff and the manager were extremely friendly and helpful. The pool was great for our daughter to relax at. Only had breakfast at the restaurant but the food was very good and the view of the Marina was so nice. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “For the economic family getaway”
Reviews.Author: Shawna00
Reviews.Content: Nice 3-star hotel. The grounds of the hotel are wonderful and the surrounding area is quiet and lovely, but not too far from things-to-do. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Do not bother eating at the restaurant, there is a limited selection, which includes nothing special. There are some great restaurants nearby. The cleanliness of the room was substandard. Keeping the 3-stars in mind, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “thieves!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: peanutCanada
Reviews.Content: i have travell alot and the service we received at the kona kai was the worst ever!!! We had a full duty free bag, over $100. value taken from are room. Whan we repôrted it to the front desk nobody. seemed to care! we were constantly brushed off. the theft was bad enough but the treatment we received from the security guard, manager and front desk is what upsets us the most! No compassion!! would not recommend this place. Humpheys up thE road will be where we stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chiprinaldo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kona Kai resort last June and had a great time. Rooms were clean, staff were friendly and the place was kept up quite well (dining was expensive however). I got my room through Priceline and lucky for me, I got a 2nd floor room that looked over the Marina for cheap! The only issue I had with them is that the magnetic stripe on their key cards is weak and prone to keep you out of the room at times... but that just maybe a problem I just had. Aside from that, it's a great resort and located in a quiet spot (end of Shelter Island). 4 out of 5 stars from me!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in Sunny San Diego”
Reviews.Author: bigmom1085
Reviews.Content: We visit family members every Spring Break in San Diego and have for the last 8 years. We've stayed in other locations, but none beats the Kona Kai on Shelter Island. Across the Bay from Downtown and just 15 minutes by car, 5 minutes from the airport, close to Interstate 5 and Interstate 8, yet away from busy traffic. We feel it's the PERFECT LOCATION! We love to walk along Shelter Island's Shoreside Park - the view includes downtown, Coronado Island, Point Loma, navy ships and cruise ships and an abundance of beautiful sailing ships! On an early morning walk, we can hear reveille being played at the Naval Station on Coronado and soon thereafter, the Star Spangled banner at the Submarine Staion on Point Loma. The walk on the north side of the resort is my husband's favorite. It follows along America's Cup Harbor and Marina where hundreds of sailboats are docked. He enjoys watching them sail in and out of the harbor. We've stayed in rooms on both sides of the resort and all have beautiful views. We enjoy the friendly and helpful staff, including the waiters in the large, beautiful restaurant where breakfast is such a treat! Oh, yes, that's a favorite of mine - the restaurant views are incredible and oatmeal brulee is delicious. In the gorgeous San Diego weather, we sometimes eat outside on the patio. The swimming pool and hot tub are beautiful and welcoming and the grounds are lovely! The beach area is a great place for children to play and there is another playground across the street at the park. Yes, we love the location because of everything mentioned, but also because we're close to Point Loma Seafood our favorite place for a fresh crab sandwich! The rooms are nice and the maids are sweet. We look forward to our next visit when we'll stay at our favorite place - The Kona Kai.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great View, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Navi71
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located across the street from the marina and the view from our room's balcony was absolutely wonderful!! I'm a very detailed person so I did notice that the hotel is an older hotel (the average person may not notice), but its very nice. There were no elevators, so be prepared if you aren't staying on the first floor (was no big deal for me). The hotel's lobby was inviting with the fireplace constantly lit. The staff was exceptionally pleasant. I felt safe walking around the marina and outside the hotel (there were 3 females in my party). We wanted good Asian cuisine in the area and the concierge really came through with his excellent recommedation of a fantastic Thai resturant near by (Spices Bay Thai Kitchen). The room and bathroom were very clean. I did have a problem with my bathroom light, the maintenance guy was very nice and tried hard to fix it, to no avail, but they provided a lamp which worked well and the hotel "comped" me for a night which I wasn't expecting. One thing that I did find unusal is that my cell phone charger wouldn't fit in the wall socket next to the AC, so I had to plug it in the bathroom wall socket, but definitely not a deal breaker. The only thing I didn't like was the hotel makes its guest pay for parking at $15/day and you had to pay to use the gym. I think parking and the gym should be free for guest. Paying for parking is the only issue that would make me rethink staying at this hotel. Other than that, I would book again at the Kona Kai!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: twhite3
Reviews.Content: Not only was the trip to San Diego a great idea, but staying at the Kona Kai made it even better. It's a beautiful resort and on a secluded island. Very quiet and close to anything you need, whether you want to take a dip in the heated pool, get a massage, eat in the restaurant, and even 5-10 minutes away from Sea World. Everything if not on the island is a 2 minute drive. There was a young lady at the front desk named Trudi that was, how do we put this......PHENOMINAL! Her expertise of the area was second to none, Informed us of the many things you could do in the area, and gave us her unbiased opinion on everything. We asked her way to many question and not once did she seemed annoyed or frusturated with any of them. It's easy to tell she keeps the morale of that place very high because there wasn't anybody there without a smile. There was also a gentleman that worked at night we were calling around 2 or 3am that was also very helpful. No need for a GPS when he's working, direction were right on the money! Overall, the experience was something we will never forget and plan on going back very soon, especially if we find out Trudi is still there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location, great help at the front desk”
Reviews.Author: mammageek
Reviews.Content: The Kona Kai is at the end of Shelter Island. Our room had a kingsize bed, and we had a little garden area that looked out to the pool and the marina beyond that. It was romantic and wonderful. Nicwe and close to downtown and Gas Lamp area. Thanks to the hotel stafffor their tips and help.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful exterior & location, but needs some in-room renovating”
Reviews.Author: SydneysMommie
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews recently and decided to go ahead and give it a try. Our family went on a valentines day weekend with plans to visit the local attractions. We were only about 10-15 minutes from Seaworld and Old town, which was great. This hotel is nestled at what i would consider a prime location. It's safe, quite and has beautiful views. The hotel is near the end of the little peninsula on Shelter Dr. From one side you have the view of the street & ocean, then the backside of the hotel has the view of the marina and beachfront. Families with children, I recommend the Marina view with a first floor room so children can play in the sand as you sit and watch from your porch. The only complaint I have about this hotel was the condition of the room. The furniture had visible wear to the wood, and the carpet needed replacing, it actually looked a bit dirty.We had plenty of towels and necessities in the room, so no complaints there. Other than that, a decent place to stay. It's not a Hilton by far, but beats a budget hotel for a little more money....and well, the views for their price is what will bring us back again.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to Trudi, our family reunion was fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: rjhallow54
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 days at the Kona Kai, where my parents and sis just met up with us. Originally scheduled for 2 nights, and then stay the remaining 2 nights in the Gas Lamp, the hotel and view was so great we decided to stay all 4 nights. Trudi helped us out, made sure we could secure the room at a great rate, and even assited friends of ours from Long Beach who where down for the day. Location is 7 mins from airport, with a view that looks like a Spanish fishing village. Pool is great, jacuzzi is well chlorinated. Next time we are in San Diego, we are staying at the Kona Kai

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting and gracious hosts at a very good value”
Reviews.Author: gray_john60
Reviews.Content: Dear Trip Advisor Users: I wanted to take the time to express what a quality experience I had while staying at the Kona Kai Resort on business. Besides offering a very clean, well appointed hotel with beautiful views and a friendly staff I found all of the amenities excellent including the food. I especially wanted to acknowledge the good service and friendly hotel lobby desk attendant; Trudy for making me feel right at home and in a very friendly environment. Her spirit left me with a warm glow for the rest of the day and hope more travelors can experience staff persons with her qualities in the hospitality industry. The pool had lane markers and lane dividers for lap swimming A+++ John Gray, Bloomfield Hills, MI

Reviews.Title: “Our perfect 20th Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: curlyisabella
Reviews.Content: Hotel was beautiful, the employees where fantastic. We where checked into a perfect room thanks to Dennis. Couldn't have made the stay any more perfect for our 20th anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “thank you trudie!!!”
Reviews.Author: levartArizona
Reviews.Content: this place was gorgeous..i was there a few nights ago with the parents and sister. we shared a room but i didn't make it there till much later than my family. i was so stressed and the lady at the desk, trudie, was so helpful it just relieved my tension that something had gone right. its a really relaxing and quite place.room service was nice.im going to be heading to san diego a few times, i know where i will be staying!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I ever paid 150/night for... quality of a truck stop”
Reviews.Author: MissouriGaspasser
Reviews.Content: Went to an anesthesia meeting there, and arrived two days early to see the sights. Arrived late in the evening, and was given a room facing a wall. Had reserved a room with an water view, and upon opening the door, the stench of animal urine hit me in the face. (evidently, they allow pets). Asked to be moved to a room that didn't smell and faced the water. Was given a room facing the road and bay upstairs over the lobby. (no elevator - had to carry bags up two flights of stairs) Room was the quality of a truck stop. Old furniture, small tv, few cable stations. Bathroom had light so dim, you couldn't see yourself in the mirror. If you were over five feet two inches, you had to bend down to get under the shower nozzle. Opening the closet door, we were once again hit with animal urine smell that since it had been closed up, it was so strong that it made me start coughing. Asked for another room. Got another one in the very same condition. Gave up since we had been traveling for twelve hours to get to the west coast and we were exhausted, so I asked them for room deodorizer spray. The faucets on the sink twirled in 360 degrees, so you had to keep turning them to get them to come on and shut off. Took a shower in the morning, and water wouldn't heat above luke warm. Walked out of the room and noticed the dirty dishes left on trays in front of two rooms next to us were still there from the night before. Headed off to go sight seeing and returned that evening, the dishes were still there and the hallway was very smelly from food left on the floor. Asked the front desk to have them removed. After two more calls over two more days, I finally called hotel manager and he seemed perturbed at the request. Said he would get them picked up immediately. Came back to my room in four hours, and one tray had been picked up and two others still remained. The hallway stunk, the room stunk... we stayed out as much as possible. The bed coverings also had animal urine smell.... I know that smell because I've had dogs all my life, and I know it well. Came home and washed everything I hung in closets because my clothes retained the putrid odor. Concierge desk is a joke. They knew nothing about restaurants or activities in the area. Couldn't arrange a simple ticket to the zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Its a Split Decision...The pool is what kept me....afloat. HAR HAR HAR”
Reviews.Author: Bilboshmoe
Reviews.Content: THE UPSIDE- The pool is huge and the hot tub is hot. The view is very pretty. The rooms are clean..a little dated, but still clean The beds are so soft and comfy. The towels are a lttle softer than typical hotels. They let us have a cot for free...saved us $20 A NIGHT The price was right. $89 USD per night The BUMMER- We asked to be moved within five minutes of getting there. The first set of rooms were....moist and dingy. We booked queen beds and got doubles. Later to find out that all of the beds are misleading. a king is a queen and a queen is a double. The restaraunt is way too expensive. Paying for parking is silly, I'm a guest at the hotel I shouldn't have to pay for parking. Theres a security guard who patrols the grounds/pool area at night. I know hes doing his job keeping the area safe., but the pool is gated and locked. Only guests of the hotel can enter that area. He interigated us every night about who we were and what we were doing. I really didn't appreciate being treated like a trespasser. Oh, and the wireless internet was pain fully slow. Either way you spin it the price was right. The beds were comfy and the pool was amazing! Minus, the pain in the rear securuty guard.

Reviews.Title: “Private, quiet and beautiful view, good location”
Reviews.Author: Gajeh702
Reviews.Content: Dennis, the manager, gave us a very nice room while we were there celebrating my 40th birthday. Our room was near the end/point of Shelter Island and it was very private with a beautiful view of the marina. Trudi was very helpful upon check-in and was very pleasant throughout our stay. She offered great points of interests and food options. She truly helped to kick-off my celebration in a positive way! Facilities were nice, however, the housekeeping was a bit lacking. The coffee stirrer packets were never replaced and there were meal trays and glasses left on the ground or on trash cans over night into the afternoon. Ice machines on Monday were not working (tried two). Also, all three keys, which were kept in separate pockets and places stopped working the 2nd night (middle of the night on entry back into parking), we had already unloaded the car from the morning and afternoons activities and were stuck outside our room with no way to get in. Husband had to walk all the way to front desk to get rekeyed as we sat outside (brrr). Had problem on re-entry through gates on a couple of occasions, but not too big of a deal. It would have been much more convenient to not have to use the room key upon exiting the parking area...just a suggestion! :o)

Reviews.Title: “Kona Kai San Diego - Awesome Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: AZClone
Reviews.Content: My young daughters and I were there for a short trip. Hotel Staff friendly and attentive to my young girls. Facility is clean and well kept. Pool awesome. Views and locations perfect. Excellent value and a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “It made me remember why I love San Diego.”
Reviews.Author: MissVegasPartyGirl57
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely perfect for my trip. First, I had a wedding to attend to in Mission Bay, so the location was perfect because it wasn't too far. The hotel was located in a quiet area along the bay in the Shelter Island Area. It was quiet, beautiful, and relaxing all in one. Dennis Vinegas, an employee there, set the reservation for the room for me. He set me up with the perfect room with an awesome view (Many thanks to Dennis!). The room was itself was cozy and comfortable, but it was the balcony that really did it for me. It was so relaxing just to sit on the balcony area and look out on the bay. Sleeping, we just left the balcony door open and let the bay breeze blow in to cool us down. Living in Vegas now, staying at the Kona Kai made me remember some of the things I truly miss the most about San Diego. The pool at the Kona Kai was a delight too. It was just as quiet and relaxing as our room. A pet peeve of mine is to be trying to relax at a pool while a bunch of young children splash you with water and scream the whole time. This was most definitely NOT the case here. Dining at the Kona Kai restaurant went just as well. My boyfriend and I couldn't resist and ordered 4 breakfast plates between the 2 of us. We opted to sit outside on the patio where the host told lead us to the table with what she dubbed as "the perfect view"....and she was right. We enjoyed our breakfast with a perfect view of both the bay and the hotel at a table with just the right amount of sunshine and a gentle breeze. If you're looking for a real hidden gem by the San Diego Bay, I completely recommend the Kona kai Resort. It's a relaxing spot with lovely rooms, beautiful views, and a very pleasant and helpful staff. Next time I am back in town, I would definitely want to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay with beautiful view and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: ro1203
Reviews.Content: Our waterfront suite was beautiful and the entire staff were very friendly and made our stay a pleasant one. We were very impressed and look forward to staying again very soon. Dennis Vinegas (Hotel Operations Manager), was very helpful and assured all of our needs were compensated.

Reviews.Title: “A great time!”
Reviews.Author: AZ_Wildcat91
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited San Diego for the first time this summer for my cousin's wedding. We chose this hotel because of the waterfront views shown on their web site. Right from the start, the staff was friendly and personable. Chrissie checked us in and also gave us precise directions on how to get to Seaworld. Later, we enjoyed the pool and later went for a walk where the view overlooked downtown San Diego. Very beautiful! With the wedding along with trying to visit as many tourist spots as possible, thank goodness the room was comfortable and adequate size for my wife and kids.

Reviews.Title: “most relaxing week ever!”
Reviews.Author: 57DK
Reviews.Content: All I have to say about this resort are wonderful things!!! Right from the beginning of our stay, the clerk from the front desk was very polite. She asked us several questions and got us the right room we wanted. We had a room overlooking the marina and the view was marvelous! We spent more time on our patio than in the actual room!!! We also spoke with a hotel employee by the name of Chrissy. She walked by us while we were in the pool area, and asked us how our stay was going. She asked us if this was our first time in San Diego, and told us about a ton of things to do while we were down here. I couldn't believe all of the things we were going to miss out on! She talked to us about sea world, balboa park, and even gave us a city map of the area and pointed out where everything was! This was hands down, the best customer service we have ever gotten at any other hotel! (Trust me, we do travel alot!) After she talked about San Diego she told us if we had any problems to call the front desk, and she would make sure that it would be fixed..well we had some problems with the movie that we ordered (we tried several times) , so we called and she was able to comp our movie!! We couldn't believe the great service we got! We definitely will go here again, thanks to Chrissy and the wonderful staff here. We couldnt have asked for a more perfect vacation! Thanks Kona Kai!! We will be seeing you again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem - Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: gdamico
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Kona Kai Resort was wonderful it is a hidden gem on the tip of Shelter Island. Our room was so quiet and very beautiful we sat on the patio watching the boats listening to the wildlife, enjoyed evening fireworks display from Seaworld on the patio, fantastic walking paths along the waterfront. Very Romantic escape. Don't miss the $5 breakfast! We will definitely stay here again. Thank's Jeff and all the staff, for making our stay so enjoyable - especially the Hawaiian Luau - The food was fantastic and the entertainment Spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “UGH!”
Reviews.Author: hamatosan
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving, had trouble getting in and out of gate -- a recurring trend all weekend. Had no water upon arrival, at all. The hotel said work was being done and it should be fixed soon. It was...until next morning. No hot water. Hotel's answer? Wait an hour, should be warm -- I didn't have time to wait -- I had an important meeting. Throughout the weekend, maid service came to the room and barely fixed anything. Bed was made in a manner similar to what I think my two year old would do. My wife and I had bug bites and irritation on our skin and room was moldy, with shower curtain having black spots. This SHOULD be a four star hotel, if the crew cared. Instead, it is bottom of the barrel -- a travesty for the beautiful area it surrounds.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: abby084
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel from July 15th-21,2009. I was hosting a family reunion. The hotel is a return visit for the family they did such a great job 4 years ago that we had to return. This time even better than before. We had a wonderful time the hotel staff were great to work with. Dennis and Amber were terrific. The rooms, food and bar were excellent. The hotel was very accommodating and would highly recommend anyone to stay at this fabulous hotel on the bay and marina. I cannot say enough positive things about this hotel and its staff. Everyone wants to come back in 4 years at the same location. A BIG THANKS TO ALL ESPECIALLY DENNIS AND AMBER. Hope to see you soon. My husband and I may take a mini vacation!!!!!!!! Kathy Love the Lula and Movies on the grass too

Reviews.Title: “A perfect affordable romantic getaway.”
Reviews.Author: tmeston
Reviews.Content: I took my fiance here for our 4 year aniversary and we absolutley loved the atmosphere. On a tiny island in between the Bay and a marina, the hotel felt like an expensive romantic honeymoon spot but at a fraction of the price. Dennis, the Front Desk Manager, found us a beautiful room overlooking the bay. The next face we met was a security gaurd who told us where our room was. Said his name was Peter Stuart. He let us know the times for the pool and the other services at the hotel. Surprisinly friendly for a hotel security guard. Overall, the stay couldn't have gone better.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a fair price in a uniquely beautiful location !!!”
Reviews.Author: gonago
Reviews.Content: My family of 3 spend one great relaxing Sunday night in early August. (We booked online a day early with no problem -in order to escape another hotel where we had an horrible experience!!) The Kona Kai Resort is a very quiet hotel because it is the last resort at the end of Shelter Island Drive in Shelter Island Park. Our room had the ocean side view on the entry to San Diego Harbor with The Coronado visible across the channel. Service was very fine. The only negative complain I have was that the hotel wifi internet access was spotty at best. I do recommend this hotel to everybody !!!

Reviews.Title: “First Time Last Time”
Reviews.Author: Wildkite
Reviews.Content: Small room. Charged to workout in gym. Large charge for parking. Forced to wait until check-in time. Watched as a possible patron was denied an examination of room. Called desk because of internet problems...told to fix the problem myself. Internet rarely worked. I fly to SD twice/yr for business...won't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Kona Kai is just gorgeous.”
Reviews.Author: robbielynn
Reviews.Content: I had a 2nd floor room, with a small balcony, facing the bay. It was great to watch all the ships passing. The room was nicely decorated; the tile on the bathroom sink area was striking. Breakfast in the restaurant was a little pricey, but the amount of food was enormous. The pool area was very nice. The interior and exterior public spaces were so beautiful. The Kona Kai is located on the far tip of Shelter Island, just a few miles from downtown San Diego. Close enough to get to town quickly, but far enough away to be so very quiet and relaxing. Great staff and concierge. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, very accommodating!”
Reviews.Author: badgerofdarkness
Reviews.Content: The Kona Kai is a beautiful hotel in a beautiful location. I was traveling with the AUVSI robotics competition, and the hotel staff was particularly welcoming. Our rooms were excessively messy with machine parts, and we even shifted the furniture. Furthermore, they allowed us to test our equipment off their docks and in their pool. The desk staff was informative, and helpful, especially Trudi. They were knowledgeable about the area, and helped us print our shipping labels and other documents at no charge. On top of all this, the hotel is in the middle of beautiful San Diego. I'd stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Falcon66
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Kona Kai for weeklong conference with wife and two small children. Resort exceeded my expectations in terms of location and facilities. Mentioned family upon check in and was given room with access to pool courtyard. Staff was extremely helpful with all requests (esp. Sergio) and would recommend for those looking for a quieter spot to base their SD vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place and Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Dianeinphoenix
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed my stay at Kona Kai. Location, location, location. Could not have a better location on the San Deigo Bay. Walk right out of the resort in either direction and you will find beautiful scenery on the bay. You could stay here without needing a car. Just walk along the bay, eat at their fabulous restaurant and relax by the pool. The rooms are clean and the suites have a great floor plan. What topped it off was the friendly and helpful staff. Trudi (front desk staff) truly cared that our stay was perfect and assisted us in every way possible. When looking for a terrific place to stay, consider Kona Kai. I will be back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTeacher00
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to my stay at the Kona Kai for a month, but now wish I had booked elsewhere. The hotel is in a wonderful location and I enjoyed waking up to see the ships each morning, but that is about all I was happy with. The room was very oudated. I was in the wheelchair accessable room (although we are both able bodied), so that may be the reason for some of the differences than what others describe. The bathroom was very outdated and there was no place to put personal items, although the spiders seemed to like it. Many tiles were cracked and there appeared to be small spots of mold on the wallpaper. Only one curtain opened to look out on the patio, which we never sat on. It overlooked the maintance shed and anyone in the parking lot had access to it. The refrigerator was warm and every button on the remote control only changed the channel down. Housekeeping entered the room three times, even though the do not disturb sign was hanging on the door. Finally, the gate to the parking lot usually took about 3 minutes to open. On Monday night we had to go in throught the exit because the gate to the entrance would not open after 10 minutes of trying. The Kona Kai was not worth the cost, even with the AAA discount. I would recommend looking elsewhere if you are planning a trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “The Kona Kai was a real pleasure to stay at.”
Reviews.Author: dmhs82
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased we were with our visit to the Kona Kai Resort. Our first contact was with a terrific young lady at the front desk named Norma, who went above and beyond the call of duty to make sure that our accommodations were perfect. She was very friendly and professional and made us feel very welcome. In addition to Norma, Francisco in the restaurant and all of the restaurant staff were friendly and accommodating. Our meals were excellent and the service was also excellent. Our room was clean and well attended to, as was the pool, Jacuzzi, and the rest of the facility. The presence of friendly security staff was a big plus for us (and our small child). At check out, we had the pleasure of dealing with Trudi at the front desk. She was also very helpful and pleasant. She went out of her way to review our bill with us and made sure that our accommodations were to our liking. She offered her assistance with anything we might need prior to our departure. Kudos to an excellent hotel and staff.

Reviews.Title: “no service”
Reviews.Author: beach_bum097
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful location was great view was great service was horrible

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service!”
Reviews.Author: Danee79
Reviews.Content: Made reservations over the phone as a graduation gift for our daughter. We would not be traveling with her so there were many details to work out. Staff was wonderful and had all the answers. They totally made this a wonderful experience. The manager Dennis was outstanding also. I highly recommend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mjnewma
Reviews.Content: The Kona Kai was a very clean and friendly hotel. Trudi at the front desk was wonderful in getting us set up in a great room. My family enjoyed the pool and jacuzzi. We also enjoyed the sand and boats as well. I would recommend this hotel to my friends. Shelter Island was very quaint and close to everything. Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jrjackson
Reviews.Content: My husband I booked this resort last minute to drive out from Scottsdale to San Diego for Memorial Day weekend. We spent $129/night plus tax (pretty decent compared to many hotels in the area). The location is stellar! Close to everything... Shelter Island is gorgeous! When we arrived at 2am (eaaaaaaaarllly Saturday morning) Trudi was the front desk manager and assisted us in checking in. She was extremely sweet, bubbly and helpful. We were exhausted and cranky and she could tell, so she comped us some free breakfast coupons for the Kona Kai resturant. The room was nice, clean, a bit small. We had two queen beds. The view was gorgeous over looking the marina! We didn't use the pool, but the spa was nice. Very warm/hot and nice jets. We dined each morning at the resturant and enjoyed the food. We got the vegetable frittata, pancakes/waffles. It was all very yummy. Two bummers: was that parking was $15. We got $5/day discount though...which helped. And that the walls were like paper. We were awoken at about 2:30am Sunday morning when the people across the way were partying very loudly. We did call front desk and they took care of it in a timely matter. I would definitely stay at the Kona Kai again, great value!

Reviews.Title: “Much bettter than the reviews would make you think”
Reviews.Author: Angelfan
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel using priceline for $69 a night. We received a room facing the bay at first, but request a room facing the he marina. Front Desk was very nice and sent a new room key to us for a marina facing room. Beautiful view of the marina and all the yachts. Beds are okay, not bad or great. The area is a little out of the way. Your about 5-10 minutes from Old Town and 15 minutes to Downtown. You receive a refrigerator in your room and an open balcony if your not on the first floor which faces a marina and a private little beach. I really liked this little resort and would love to stay here again for the right price. The only complaint is the parking fee of $15 a night. I mean, c'mon, for the prices they charge normally, they should include the parking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property and location”
Reviews.Author: IslandParents
Reviews.Content: Like others I was freaked out by the reviews after winning this property on Priceline. We couldn't have been more pleased at how much better this property was than reviews said. We stayed in room 353 for 3 nights. Top floor, looked southwest - you cannot see the downtown skyline from this location but you have an excellent view of the harbour mouth with all the boat traffic. Beautiful property is showing its age but is clean and well maintained. The pool is particularly lovely. There was no airport noise in our room, only occasional aircraft noise from the NAS but not at night. With a modest investment and some fixing up, this property would easily be a 4 star. As it is, it is a great buy.

Reviews.Title: “Good for What I Paid”
Reviews.Author: Beachyfun
Reviews.Content: Got the Kona Kai on Priceline for $61/night. I'd read all the reviews beforehand so wasn't sure what to expect. I'd been hoping to get Best Western Island Palm or Humphries Half Moon. We arrived Fri April 10th. Check in was fairly fast with Jason at the front desk. The first room we got was a ground floor handicap access room just down the hair from front desk. On going in, the room wasn't bad as everything seemed clean and well laid out. We discovered however that the handle of the hot water faucet on the wash room sink was broken and fell right off when we tried to turn on the water to wash our hands. Then when I picked up the phone to call front desk to let them know, I discovered the phone wasn't working and had no dial tone. I went back out to Jason and front desk and he changed our room right away. We moved to room 125. Unfortunately, it wasn't quite as nice looking as the first room but as everything was working, we decided to stay in it. The lighting in this room was very very dim whereas the first room was very well lit. The bathroom was also outdated and had an old tub whereas the first room had a very newly renovated bathroom. Oh well, I guess it was a tradeoff but as long as everything was working, we were staying put. Based on the reviews I read beforehand, I bought ear plugs with me. It was a good thing I did as the first and second night was noisy. There were kids upstairs running around past 11:00 pm. I wouldn't have been able to sleep without the ear plugs. Once Sunday night hit, everything quieted down and it was peacefully quiet. Nice things about hotel: 1) It was central to everything we wanted to see. About 15 minutes to Cabrillo National Monument and 15 mins downtown. We rented a car from Alamo for $10/day so had no problem getting around. 2) Shelter Island is beautiful, peaceful and safe. It was beautiful to wake up, look out the window and see the water. 3) Housekeeping staff was very friendly. Greeted us each morning and cleaned our room well. 4) Front desk staff was very friendly and greeted us all the time. 5) Room had a fridge which was handy. 6) Free wifi internet access Bad Things: 1) Parking is expensive and you don't really have a choice but to pay for their parking there ($15/night) 2) Our room lighting was poor and washroom needed upgrades 3) Really bad pillows here so if that's important, bring your own. 4) Hotel doesn't provide towels at the pool area. You have to bring your own or the room towel. All in all, for the money I paid, I felt I got a fair deal. I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “BEST GET AWAY”
Reviews.Author: MACLomaLinda
Reviews.Content: my wife recently fractured her back and i thought it would do her good to getaway. i went through AAA and found this place, the staff was outstanding---dennis,sergio and joseph were way ahead of there game. meet all of our needs didnt pay nothing for parking. the room and the view was outsatnding. i would go back to this hotel again, and again we are very happy the way the staff treated us and made us fill right at home.

Reviews.Title: “Little bad surprises around every turn....”
Reviews.Author: Kauaikid
Reviews.Content: We went to the Kona Kai for a weekend get-away. We found Shelter Island and the Kona Kai easily using the Garmin. Upon our arrival we were told there would be an additional $15 per night for parking! To me this is absolutely outrageous! This charge should either be included into the room price, or absorbed by the hotel. This is a hotel without parking! Also, after dinner my wife wanted some water and ice. I covered the entire second floor of our building looking for an ice machine. Then I went downstairs to the lobby and asked about the location. I was told if I go down to room 115 and look for an exit that would be the ice machine. I gave them my special look and the receptonist took my ice bucket and went to the kitchen and got some ice for me. I thought that was nice, but I still didn't have the water. I went back looking for the ice machine. There was NO SIGN indicating that there may be ice and soda machines anywhere. Very poor service indeed! After a while I found the machines. They were hidden outside by the pool. I was on the second floor and there were no services available on our floor and NO signs directing you to the services either. The rooms were clean. The furniture in our room was well worn. I will say this for the Kona Kai and it's location: it was a very quiet place. The view of the city from our room was blocked by trees. So we got to look across the water at what appeared to be a military installation. Not too pretty. We did enjoy watching the fishermen retrieving pots and speculating on what they were catching. We also enjoyed the sounds of the seals barking... All in all, we had a good time despite the difficulties given us by the Kona Kai. In case you're wondering I think that the extra $15 for parking is more than enough reason NOT to stay here. We were told that parking may be extra, but who would expect it to cost as much as a 1/2 tank of gas for one night?! Poor way to treat "guests" if you ask me! (after spending $200+ for a night in a mediocre room.) Luckily we were smart enough not to eat there! Ruth's Chris Steak House is not far away and is good. There was a Japanese restaurant near the hotel that we noticed was packed with eaters and we wished we had tried them!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend getaway, service was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: etrnaltangerine
Reviews.Content: I wanted to have a nice weekend getaway with my boyfriend for Valentine's Day but we were on a bit of a budget and it wasn't easy finding a place. I found the Kona Kai on a travel site and decided to give it a try. I spoke with Peter and he was so helpful! He understood our situation and found the perfect room for us. He was very knowledgeable about the sites of San Diego. Peter told us a list of hotspots for dining and dancing. The room had a great view and service was exceptional. Check out was very easy and the employees were really friendly. Every time a friend asked about a hotel I tell them to check out the Kona Kai and ask for Peter because his customer service is one of a kind. He'll really fine tune your trip to fit it to your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place if you want to get ripped off”
Reviews.Author: carmelea82
Reviews.Content: My husband came down four days from chicago to visit me (Navy school) and we decided we wanted to have a little Valentine get away. From the website Kona Kai Resort and Spa seamed like the place to be at the time. My first impression was that it was really nice on the outside when i walked in i was a bit disapointing because the rooms were so small and a bit out dated. The sink was very small barely had any room for anything. The building is older so their was a lot of creaks and squiks at night which freaked me out. I am a fair person It was a clean hotel though when we got back to our room everyday the room had been cleaned. We had a King size bed and it was very confy and spacious. :) We made reservation for Valentines at the resteraunt at Kona Kai and it was very small and over priced the food was disgusting me and my husband even joked and said that we should of went to Jack in the box and we would of been more satisfied. I love fish but the salmon tasted as if it was days old and the salad was a cheap lettuce head and one small tomatoe and a two baby carrots. The only fairly descent food was the desert. we ended up paying over $150 for 4 pieces of lettuce one small tomatoe, two baby carrots and a little plastic cup with dressing, a under cooked a few days old salmon with a cup of over boiled rice, and a small little dessert which was the only half way descent food of the meal. I was furious because we could not eat the food it was so disgusting. We only ate desert. Later when i checked out they had charged me and extra $92.00 for some other persons room service and made me seam as though i was crazy who was trying to get a cheap discount. When the receptionist finally decided to do her job and investigate she realized that i was rite i never ordered that food it was another room. and told me that it had been put back on my card. Well I dropped my husband off at the airport and went home with a broken heart to come to realize that not only had she not given back my $92.00 she had charged it on my account plus kept the original balance. so she had charged me for some other persons meal twice. well i called and spoke to accounting which was a self centered unproffessional who called me a liar and said that the receptionist had not charged me. Well I told her that I had been charged for the meal seperate from my hotel bill because why would my bank show a individual charge of $92.00 all our room service was added to the total amount due. she was rude and not helpful she almost made me cry because she was set to not help me. I asked to speak to her manager and she pretty much told me their was not one else above her I was furious at this point because she was refusing me my right to speak to a manager. Finally she transfered me to the hotel manager that all of a sudden mysteriously she happened to have a manager. I got his voice mail and left a detailed message with all my phone numbers. In a process of about three days i left two to three messages a day and never not once recieved a phone call back. On the fourth day I looked at my account online and saw exactly was i suspected I was charged the original amount which included the extra $92.00 and an individual $92.00 charge. than I was refunded twice $92.00. so not only was i correct but i am still trying to get in contact with someone their to explain how badley i was treated and i have yet to recieve a phone call back. They are rood, inconciderate, mean, and a big rip off. One advice i would give the staff of Kona Kai would be smiling with your voice goes a long way, and not accusing the guest a paying guest at that we lert over $1000 their, of being a liar. Admitt to your mistake and the least I would expect would be an apology. Never again this was a horrible expeirience.
