Oh yah And the heater kept breaking and everytime we would call the front desk they would get mad at us as though it was our fault that their electric system was old and kept making the heater blow out. The last time we called for some one to come and fix it the receptionist gave me an attitude and was like " their is an extra blanket in the closet" " a nightmare!" endless horror stories of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do It...”
Reviews.Author: tajikpeace
Reviews.Content: I realize that some are looking for a less expensive hotel to stay at in a relatively expensive hotel market. But, for your own sake, keep on looking past the Kona Kai. The rooms were run down, the area is not very good (nothing to walk to), and the staff were less than enthusiastic about receiving us. Actually, we were ok staying there because they had a complementary shuttle service from the airport, which they said ran from 5am till 11pm. When I called them at 9:30pm for my shuttle, they told me that it was a slow night, so they sent their driver home... and that I'd need to take a taxi at my expense. I finally persuaded the manager to cover the cost of the taxi. Even though checkout was later, I got out of there at 8am... I couldn't wait to leave. I know their price is lower... just know that you'll be getting what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable with a wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: mnyvent
Reviews.Content: We spent one week in this hotel and enjoyed the whole stay. We were fortunate to have a full view of San Diego Bay with all of the activities. The sunrises were spectacular and the walk along the bay front was beautiful with a full view of San Diego and Point Loma. We were close to some very fine restaurants and a great shopping mall, as well as our very own Church. The room was comfortable and well appointed, and the service was great. We enjoyed the lounge and the dining room, and took advantage of the work out Club. We would strongly recommend this Hotel for a relaxed stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for vacation, British people will like it.”
Reviews.Author: ibuprofenman
Reviews.Content: Booked a few weeks prior using PriceLine. I had been anticipating a different hotel so was quite surprised when this turned up. Immediately I checked up on TripAdvsior and was a bit apprehensive given some of the reviews but it turned out to be one of my most enjoyable hotel stays ever. Arrived late on Tuesday 2/12 and was allocated room 202 which is very close to the front of the hotel. Has a balcony with view of pool and rear of hotel, in decent condition, nice size fridge that would take 2 large bottles of Coke in door. Also fast WiFi and was given a UK-US power adapter. Both the fridge and WiFi are included in the price !!! The decoration of the room is not new but certainly not detrimental to enjoying your stay. The staff were very friendly including Enrique and Margorie. Walk around hotel and you get some spectacular views of downtown in the distance and 1000s of yachts to the rear of the hotel. 100 yards or so down the road is the fishing pier where the pelicans do indeed hang around expecting to be fed and it seems this is a tourist site in itself. The area around the hotel feels very safe and we decided to park for free on the road outside as the hotel. As I said in my title, British will really like this place if they have hired a car because everywhere is just 15-20 minutes. In my opinion, it's not a business or overnight hotel, it's a place to spend a few days, relax and escape the faster pace of life.

Reviews.Title: “Big room, but a little far from town”
Reviews.Author: TXStevePen
Reviews.Content: We booked this room directly with the hotel after checking the reviews on Trip Advisor. The property is at the every end of Shelter Island on the north end of San Diego Bay. A few items to be aware of. If you are going to a convention or something downtown this property is about a 15 minute drive from there. Second, there's not a lot of restaurants in the neighborhood. Third, Point Loma air station is right across the channel - and it can be very noisy when the jets are launching or landing. Fourth, there's an extra charge for parking ($15 per day when we were here). Aside from this the property is attractive and the rooms large (we were upgraded to a junior suite which was about twice the size of a standard room anywhere else). Service was good. The AC unit had some mold and dust on it, and since my wife is very allergic we asked for maintenance to clean it. They arrived in less than 10 minutes and cleaned it thoroughly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Check for Bugs”
Reviews.Author: Shivas1Irons
Reviews.Content: After attempts to get management's attention via email and snail mail to no success, here we go...is it a coincidence that our daughter experiences bites on her back the first night, then my wife, and finally me? Too bad, all I asked was that management check the room and inform me of their actions. No response, nada.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible value and even worse service!”
Reviews.Author: Californian2
Reviews.Content: The best thing I could say about Kona Kai is the location, but then there are other choices on Shelter Island and elsewhere in San Diego. You only have to read others' reviews of the condition of the rooms to get the picture; I had a similar experience and have nothing to add in that department. My real problem was with the complete lack of good service and even a sense of accountability among staff, even at the management level. Honestly, the best hotel I've stayed in in this part of San Diego was at the Holiday Inn San Diego at 1355 N Harbor Drive. I enjoyed the service and the on-site restaurant. From my waterfront room at the Holiday Inn I had great views, and enjoyed watching the grand cruise ships arrive and load passangers. Stay away from Kona Kai!!

Reviews.Title: “not bad...pricy though”
Reviews.Author: rpmbookeeper
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the resort for one night while attending a wedding. The facility was great but I got to my room and was surprised when I discovered I payed 200 dolllars for a motel room. It wasnt anything special. It has a very nice location, facilities, pool, etc, however, I wish I had just stayed at one of the motels located on Rosecrans.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: greydog7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a lovely location but the bad outweighed the good. Upon our arrival I was dismayed to see that our room had stained and old carpet, and was rather small for the price. Our phone did not work nor did the toilet upon our arrival. The maintenance man did arrive fairly promptly to fix these. We stayed for three days and our toilet acted up once each day requiring a visit from the maintenance man. On our last day there, he didn't even bother to show up so I had to fix the toilet myself. I paid an extra amount for a "premium view" of the harbor, meaning unobstructed. There were palm trees right in the middle of our view, see attached picture. I complained about this but they would not refund the extra amount to me. Front desk help was not friendly, nor was manager. Though the rooms are nonsmoking, our neighbors right below us smoked continually on thier balcony which drifted right up and into our open balcony door. We were unable to enjoy our balcony because of this. Management would not move us. I had high hopes for this hotel, but they did not materialize. I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice locale, but needs maintenance”
Reviews.Author: tcardona
Reviews.Content: The location and setting for the Kona Kai Resort are very nice. but the rooms could use soon serious maintenance. We stayed in room 131 in Mid August and the screen door to the patio area was completely broken-couldn't open it or close it, the bathroom door wouldn't closed(door too big for its opening) and so could not be locked. The room had 2 coffee makers but no iron. We enjoyed our day by the pool and beach(surprisingly, there were well behaved children by the pool that day-a rarity). But the whole ambience was spoiled by the constant hassle of the 2 offending doors. So, if mgt is listening, invest in new screen doors, redo the scruffy bathtubs.Its the little things that matter, you know. Location alone only goes so far.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: FunInAz6
Reviews.Content: Kona Kai Resort and Spa was my choice of visit because it was cheaper then most hotels, and a friend told me he was there when it was known as Shelter point, and he enjoyed it. My experience with the hotel was o.k. It was slightly spoiled when I arrived to learn that the rate they reserved me for over the phone was not the rate they had me in the computer for. I argued politely with the lady behind the counter saying thats not the rate I reserved it for, Though it went nowhere So i just swallowed my pride not wanting to ruin the trip and accepted the 20 dollars more a day rate. As for the rest of the stay I was pleased with how clean the room was and the prompt room service, they did a good job. The Kids playground was a little small I was expecting something a little bit larger, So we took the kids to another playground not far away on the Shelter island. Sand volleyball nexy to the marina was nice, just dont hit the ball in the water. Heated pool and spa was a plus as it was chilly most the time. I didnt like paying for nightly parking, Or that They were unable to honor the reservation. If I decide to come back I will reserve online and get a printout of the hotel webpage with the confirmation #.

Reviews.Title: “good,bad, and ugly”
Reviews.Author: blinders
Reviews.Content: we were put up by the airlines the name sounded like a cheap hotel but the location was amazing.they do provide a free shuttle to and from the airport and around the area. people at the desk were not overly friendly but were good at giving us the kind of room we wanted which is nice since the airlines payed for it. there is no elavater,but they have a bell hop.there is no micowave,but a refg..room was very clean and comforable with great views of the harbor.the pool area was very clean and one could order off a pool menue.fyi the main buiding has not remodel their rooms so ask for building two or three.breakfast was in the 7 to 11 price range and kids meals were 5.00 food was above averg..if i was to go back i would buy milk and cereal. down side parking was 15.00 a day ,no micwave,no free brakfast. ugly our shuttle driver had a chip on his shoulder and was mad that we did not tip him for the free ride to the airport and thur my grandson suitecase on the ground,even before he know if i was tipping or not.also asked for a dinner idea since we had my 5 year grandson with.the place had no kids meals or even small potions. he was the only child and prices were high about 18.00 for pasta. we could not leave as the shuttle had drop us.found out later from another driver that there is a kids friendly place that he send family too,which we had gotten him first. one really nice thing if one has a pm flight out insteady of checkout at 12;30 you can pay a half dayroom rate

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: merrybucks
Reviews.Content: The views are great. Our room had a view of the Kona Kai harbor. The staff is very friendly. The place was clean and quiet. Overall a great experience. We definately will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: SanDliving
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. We enjoyed our stay very much. The room was clean and the beds were super comfortable. We had a lovely view of the pool and marina area with several tropical plants right outside our balcony. The room was very quiet - we did not hear anyone walking up or down the hallway as we usually do in hotels. The pool was nicely heated and they had a nice little sand beach with a playground for the kids. The only setback was the $10 charge for use of the gym. Great experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Not a resort experience!”
Reviews.Author: gottogonow34
Reviews.Content: This place should be called the Kona Why? It was certainly not what I expected after looking at the website and spending hours reviewing various hotels in San Diego. This appeared to be a good hotel on booking and reasonably priced for a 2 night stay for my family of 4 plus inlaws. The only plus was that the rooms had a water view. This place is in desperate need of a facelift, from worn and dirty carpets, scraped wallpaper in walkways, dirty grout around windows in the rooms and to make it even worse mold in the bathroom above the light fixture, disgusting! The breakfast room has a nice marina view but was pretty deserted for Spring break, I should have guessed, extremely expensive! We spent $105 for 6 people which I think is expensive for eggs. Save your money and go to the Point Loma cafe, (within 2 miles) where we spent $60 for the same thing and it was very clean and good service too. Another point to make is that this hotel charges you $10 just to use the gym!! I have never stayed anywhere where this occurs, what a nice perk for guests that was! The drinks machine also seemed to be out of drinks conveniently, so you are forced to go to the bar. A good ploy by management. This place is average but has the potential to be nice if the management cared. Not a resort though!

Reviews.Title: “can't complain”
Reviews.Author: Bowline
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kona Kai for two nights for a business conference that was held on-site. Overall, the hotel was clean and well-maintained. My room had been recently updated and contained new-appearing good quality furniture, nice bedding (good sheets, comfortable mattress, clean bedspread), and an adequate bathroom. The plumbing worked well. Carpet appeared new and was very clean. The room had a private balcony overlooking a beautiful pool area and a high-end yacht harbor. The air conditioner was a bit noisy, but maintained the room's temperature nicely. The restaurant was very nice with sweeping views of the harbor and hills through floor to ceiling windows. The staff was courteous and efficient, and the food was of good quality, although pricey. The pool area was exceptional for its views, comfort and cleanliness. The pool was quite large for a hotel, and the hot tub was very nice. The conference I attended was held in three meeting rooms, which were kept quite cold. I needed a jacket to stop my shivering. The rooms were well equipped and spacious. Overall, I was satisfied with this hotel and its very nice location. I will stay here again. I consider myself to be very picky.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location, rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Drew2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kona Kai for a conference with a conference rate that was about $100 less than the normal rates. I would not pay the going rates to stay here. However, the hotel has amazing views from everywhere on the property. The grounds are nice and it's actually quite a small hotel. Shelter Island has a neat waterfront walkway with people jogging and walking dogs. It's truly what San Diego is all about....being outside and enjoying the water and sunshine. The hotel is fine. I would say it is on par with any generic Doubletree hotel. The staff are generally nice and helpful. I had to wait until after 4pm to get my room even though others I was with got into their rooms at 9:30am. The next day my room wasn't serviced until after 4:30pm. But they were completely full and our conference was there after all. About the room...I was given a ground floor room in the first building next to the main building. Every ground floor room has a patio and all other rooms have balconies, which is really nice. But my room was a wheelchair accessible king room, so the bathroom was extra large and the sink and toiletries were out of the toilet and shower/bathtub room. The toiletries are ok; the brand is Gilchrist and Soames. The bedding is terrible and has a bedspread that is the old type that probably isn't ever washed. The tv was old and the air conditioning is located under the window and is controlled from the unit itself. One night it was cold in the room and the other night it was really warm and the settings were the same both nights. The patio furniture was dirty and I didn't want to sit on it. My room faced the bay but the building is lower than the parking lot in front of it, so it's difficult to see much. If you want to see the bay, ask for a room above ground floor. The other thing that was not good about the room was that I killed about 4 spiders, and some of them weren't small. I lived in San Diego for 4 years, so I know about the bugs there, but for a hotel that charges a lot of money, they should do something about that. I did not use the exercise facility this time but I did last year. It's nice and they have a lot of cardio machines. There is a "spa" there with a few treatment rooms. It seems like there are locals that use the gym there, so maybe they have memberships. On the plus side, the conference food is good. I didn't try the restaurant food. They do have free wifi about everywhere in the hotel and around the grounds, which is nice. If you want an average hotel in a great location this is the hotel for you. It seems to be family-friendly too. I would not call this hotel luxurious though.

Reviews.Title: “Almost didn't stay here”
Reviews.Author: traveljps
Reviews.Content: We had to take our daughter to college in San Diego & needed a hotel for the weekend. Because I was busy with college preparations I put my husband in charge of making the hotel reservations. He found the hotel on Google & booked it because it had a lap pool. I checked the reviews on this site & because there were so many negative reviews I really didn't want to stay there; but the price was right & we didn't have time to find something else. I was pleasantly surprised to find the hotel was really nice. I was expecting a dump with indifferent staff & found just the opposite. We stayed in a room with 2 queen beds overlooking the pool & facing the marina our first night. The second night because our daughter was moving into the dorm we requested a move to a room with a king size bed. They had no problem accomadating us. This room was on the first floor & faced the harbor & downtown. Both rooms were clean. Neither had any of the smells that were mentioned in other reviews. Both rooms were spacious & nicely furnished. My husband really enjoyed the lap pool, & I enjoyed walking along the water. I thought this hotel was great for the price. We paid $149 for Thursday night & $239 for Friday. Compared to some of the hotels that I had checked before putting my husband in charge, I thought it was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting, awful hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Redpandachicago
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a wedding that I was attending on the property. From the moment we arrived the service was sub-par for the rates that were charged. Although we booked a room with a king-sized bed 6 months in advance, we were told that booking a certain type of room is just a "preference" and is not necessarily taken into account. Not only was this a problem for us, but when the bride arrived the night before the wedding they could not "locate" her reservation for the bridal suite! We paid for "rushed" same day cleaning, only to receive our items 5 hours later than promised , 15 minutes before we needed to leave for an event. The toilet in the first room wouldn't flush and the sink was leaking and the bathroom in our second room needed to be re-caulked about 5 years ago. The entire property is badly in need of an overhaul....it smelled and looked like I had just walked into my grandmother's house when I walked into the room and the outside of the properly badly needs to be refurbished. Definitely not worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed again, liked it again.”
Reviews.Author: DeathLlama
Reviews.Content: Wife, toddler, and I stayed there again this last weekend. Two nights, this time. It was fine, mostly. Just some minor things: the bathroom door didn't shut easily, same with the curtains, and the pillows were way too hard for us. But overal, it was great. The staff was friendly and helpful, and I also enjoyed exercising in the lap pool ealry in the morning. As noted by others, the location is a ways away from downtown, but for us that was a plus. I liked the remote feeling. No traffic noise whatsoever, and the local shops and restaurants seemed more laid back than in the city itself. Also we enjoyed sitting out on our balcony and watching all the boats pass by. A bonus for me was watching the two F16 that took off from NAS North Island and roared overhead. My little boy wasn't so sure about that, but he'll come around. Anyhow, it was a pleasant experience, and we'll probably book it again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine stay but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: laangelsfan
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego for what turned out to be an abbreviated trip for a conference for work. While the hotel was okay, I really disliked the location at least from the convention center, and the drive during rush hour took a bit longer than any of the hotels near by the convention center, although that's really not anyone's fault as my work booked the trip. Driving to the hotel and once on Shelter Island, we passed many other seemingly nicer hotels that I later found out cost the same or less. Once at the hotel, I was placed in the last building, and one of the last rooms, a handicapped room. Neither of the keys they gave me worked and I had to walk all the way back to the lobby, and wait in the line that had formed while I checked in. The reception staff was not particularly friendly or helpful. Once entering my room, it was immediately noticeable it was a handicapped room, low sink, grab bars all over the bathroom, etc. I usually don't request room changes unless something is really bothering me (like smoke from a neighboring room), so I stayed and it was fine, although I had wondered if I was given this room because I got a cheaper government rate. Who knows. Anyway, the room was nothing special and I could not tell whether or not the room had been renovated, somethings seemed to be newer than others (like doors) while the bed and bathroom seemed dated. The pool was nice and had a pretty nice view, and while sitting in the jacuzzi at night, I could see the fireworks from sea world. The hotel wasn't anything special, but it served its purpose. I don't think I'd stay there again though seeing as you can get a similar deal for a closer and newer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to relax and enjoy the elements”
Reviews.Author: grny
Reviews.Content: our expericane at the kona kai was very nice. the restaurant was excellent. the views were awesome. we didnt rent a car, we walked and took advantage of public transportation. this place is close to airport, downtown, and old town by way of bus. 2.25 urban fare. the resort wasnt real helpful with information regarding things to do in the area. the driver though(free shuttle) was most helpful . the room was somewhat outdated, carpet worn, but what can you expect near water. it wasnt as bad as some of the other reviews suggested. its a very relaxing place, so it would have been nice to have coffee mugs in the room rather than paper cups. you could bring your own good coffee to enjoy at your leisure. we found in general the folks we ran accross in san diego just really lacked that friendly smile. people are much more friendly in the bay area. we would definely return though. we had a wonderful stay and dont have any complaints that would stop us from returning. plenty of things to do on shelter island if you just want to be leisurly. plenty of restaurants and places to party if you dont want to leave the island. i'm a real stickler about cleanliness, and i was comfortable here. they will be renovating later this year, cant wait till it is complete to return.

Reviews.Title: “This is a nice place!”
Reviews.Author: ervbo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from 4 days at the Kona Kai. It is a very nice place and we enjoyed our time there. We would definitely go back. Here are the pros and cons of our experience: Pros- very good value. They had a spring break special of $159/nt. Great pool with a lap lane (I am a swimmer). Great views on both sides (harbor and bay)- you cant lose on view with a room on either side. Very peaceful and restful during the day. Very nice room and balcony. Free internet that I could get, even on the beach (bay side). Nice jacuzzi. Good food at restaurant. We did not notice any carpet problems or mildew smell as a previous reviewer. Free shuttle was nice and they will drop you off and pick you up anywhere between the hotel and the airport. We did not rent a car. We enjoyed renting bikes and riding them down to the gaslamp area. Wonderful! They only charge $5 for 2 hours and even gave us a little extra time :) Great place to jog along the bay or on one day I ran north up to the top of tjhe hill and the Pt Loma bible college. Plenty of free parking ont he street. Lille kids playground on their beach. Cons- Noisy at times at night. The walls do seem a bit thin but mostly when my neighbors ran water, it was very loud in my room and would wake me up. It was a Pro for me but could be a Con for you that the hotel is at the end of the isalnd and sort of removed from everything. Easily solved by renting a bike or car, though. One day the maid forgot to make up our room. :( The staff was fine but not overly friendly. Shuttle driver gave us good advice on places to eat. I really liked the touch of Venice restaurant down the way. Water taxi only ran between 3-9. Better to ride bike to the real water taxi by the russian sub- it goes all day and is super cheap. Our objectives were to rest, spend a lot of the time at the pool ride our bikes along the bay, not need a car and eat pretty well. Our objectives were certainly met :)

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here when it was Shelter Pointe Hotel ... it was "okay"”
Reviews.Author: jetlagnow
Reviews.Content: After having stayed at just about all of the hotels on Shelter Island (and unless this one has been recently upgraded)... I would rate it dead last. It doesn't have the charm or character of the Best Western or Humphries. The parking lot is tedious. My room had outdated decor, ugly color scheme and the architecture is fairly hideous. The location is great on Shelter Island, but that is about the only good thing. It was just... "adequate" which for the price you expect a better experience. The bed was okay comfortable. The screen was broken on the sliding glass doors and the screen material was peeling into the room. Just felt a bit ripped off for the price. The lobby was full of people milling about for various weddings in the neighborhood -- kind of annoying atmosphere. The vibe wasn't really quaint or tropical or laid back like Best Western (which had free fresh chocolate cookies on their front desk) or Humphries (which had snotty desk people but a nice tropical feeling & flow to the property). Kona Kai is sort of lame and uptight. Can't describe it really. The "view" from the rooms is obstructed partially. Just an okay experience. Would rate it a C+. I prefer the Best Western down the street and even Humphries for about the same price range. It's better than staying in a motel-8, but for the money, you expect more. I haven't tried the one called the Bay Inn (I think?) but one lady in the parking lot told me that she liked it and that they had a free brunch, which none of the other Shelter Island hotels offer (to my knowledge). So I would try that or Best Western, then Humphries.

Reviews.Title: “Love the View, but the carpets............”
Reviews.Author: Laura_Jean61
Reviews.Content: Great location, awesome view and they upgraded us to a better room. But.......... the carpets were disgusting. My 2 year old always had dirty feet and I could not walk around barefoot or with white socks. I had to wash my feet before I got in bed every night. Very gross!!! I commented to the front desk and they said the owner was going to be remodeling in early 07. Hopefully. Other than that, the place was very nice. They waived the parking fee, the food was good (and a bit pricey). If they have truly remodeled, I would recommend this place in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - less than friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: OHi0Traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, situated on Shelter Island. One side of the hotel faces San Diego Bay while the other side faces the Marina. The hotel is expansive and it is difficult to navigate from one end of the hotel to the other since it is made up of different buildings. My room had a private patio facing the Bay, and was comfortable although wireless internet was virtually non-existent in the building in which my room was located. I also requested, and was assured that I would receive, a morning wake up call, which I did not receive. Another person in my party also did not receive his wake up call. They do run a shuttle between the hotel and airport, but reserve space early as it is only a van that can only hold 5 people, including the driver, with luggage. The shuttle driver was much more friendly than the front desk staff and took the time to ask how our visit had been and what could be improved upon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice views, rooms a bit small.”
Reviews.Author: CMCNJ
Reviews.Content: Every room in this hotel has a lovely view of the Harbor and/or marinas, the pool is great as is the hot tub. Great location for people who want to relax and take walks. The restaurant was adequate. Staff was friendly and helpful but often too busy to help quickly. A room with two queen beds had only 3 very small drawers and one small closet. The bathroom was large, but mostly floor space -- tub and toilet in a large room. The sink and vanity outside was tiny, barely room for the coffee pot on one side and a small basket with washcloths on the other -- barely any room for toiletries. Hotel provides shuttle service to airport and will take you to other locations if someone is available to do so, but the drivers sub as bell personsso are often busy. Some tour buses and trolleys will pick up there, but if a taxi is needed, it's about $25 to downtown, Oldtown or Seaport Village. Not sure I'd stay there again, since it's not a great resort hotel and too far from sightseeing locations if you don't have a car. (Parking costs $15 per day) Would rather try one of the other hotels on the islnad that had equally great views.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful location”
Reviews.Author: jstruck33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights following a cruise to the Mexican Riviera. Our room was in a great location, high floor with a balcony overlooking the harbor. The room was average but clean and comfortable. The hotel was quiet and the food at AJ's restaurant was very good. The only down side is that we didn't rent a car and had to walk or take taxis everywhere. The front desk staff was very nice and helpful. The lobby is beautiful. I would stay here again but only for a few days, not an entire week or more.

Reviews.Title: “dissappointment”
Reviews.Author: Midnighthunder
Reviews.Content: we stayed for five days. there was never ice on any floor. We didn't rent a car and the only transport service was a cab. or walk the lengh of the Island to get to food. The hotel shuttle went to the airport and wildlife park. The wild life park got us there by 11 and picked us up by 4. that wasn't enough time to see anything for the price of the enterance fee. ON our last day we learned that there was an island bus that stopped by am and pm. Lot of good that did us then. Room service took over an hour for a pot of coffee. In the end I could have stayed in town walked to starbucks. The room was fine but it was just like a quality inn room only add on was you got to look at the yachets. But I bet every room there had view since it was an island.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Spot”
Reviews.Author: spacoli
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a wedding. Location was good. Rooms were pretty nice but a little small. Pool was great. Harbor/marina views are great. Our room had a nice balcony and harbor view. Restaurant was good for breakfast. Free shuttle to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “It was Great!”
Reviews.Author: MelbaGirl
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel mainly because it looked like it would be less hectic than the other Shelter Island Hotels. I was worried after some of those reviews that I made a bad decision, I even had other hotels staked out incase. I did not have to worry. This was the perfect spot for what I was looking for. Though there was a mustiness to the hotel room, it did not smell BAD, opening the sliding glass wiindow onto the patio took care of that. The bathroom was small and yes a little worn, but it was clean. The pool was great but if you want some quiet, don't go on a weekend, too many teens and children. The room service was excellent, we ordered dinner twice and breakfast - it took 20 to 30 minutes just like they said and everything was hot. Their restaurant was very nice inside and out, I especially liked it outside as it overlooked the bay and felt private. Their bar was nice but it seems they only take your orders at poolside on Saturdays. However, a little cooler with drinks is perfect, the ice machine is close enough. We had initially booked the Marina View, that wasn't ready at time of check-in and received a room in the 210-217 portion above the lobby. This was great it was the closest to the Bay, laying on the bed we could see the water and a little patch of green. We had a great time sitting out on the porch watching everyone walking with their dogs and enjoying themselves. I looked around and a lot of the ocean views had too much parking lot as part of it. I recommend this part of the building highly. Because this hotel is at the end, it gets less car traffic. I spent a lot of time walking around the bay and marina - it is pretty enough that if you choose not to go anywhere you still get to be out of the hotel grounds and enjoy the scenery. I never once thought this place was noisy, I'm not sure if the people by the doors and ice machines felt the same way, so you may ask and be sure you are not in a traffic path. I was looking for a quiet and laid back place with no frills but clean, this was it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: WestMItraveller
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about this hotel after reading some of the very negative reviews, but our stay at Shelter Pointe exceeded my expectations. The location of the hotel is perfect, it is a 10 minute drive to anywhere in San Diego. The rooms were clean and nice, a little humid, but very nice. It is true that it isn't extremely quiet in the hotel, but we didn't hear any conversations or get woken up early in the morning. You can just hear kids outside by the pool and doors slamming in the other rooms, but it is not too bad. The hotel grounds are so beautiful, it is located in a great spot. Basically any room you have would be very nice. We reserved the cheaper room and were on the first floor with a patio out to the pool courtyard, and this was great. The pool and beach are very nice, it seems like a great place to take a family. It is annoying that parking is an extra $15 a day and they don't warn you about this, but it is really nice to park just outside the door of your building and not have to hastle with street parking or anything like that. We never ate at the hotel restaurant, but there is plenty of good dining nearby. Downtown is only 10 minutes away, and you can find anything you would want there. We ate at Miguel's Mexcian restaurant one night, it is on the corner of Scott St. & Shelter Island Drive, it was good and inexpensive. So if you have a reservation here, don't cancel it just because of those negative reviews. I was very impressed with the hotel and the grounds, and there is so much to do in San Diego that you'll never be in your room anyway.

Reviews.Title: “The WORST Hotel I've Ever Seen”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Kona Kai at Shelter Pointe in San Diego, CA was represented by Hotels.com in their Hotel Features as "Tropical splendors greet guests as they approach this unique destination that promises plentiful recreational diversons and soothing amenities. From basking in the sun on the island's sandy beaces to arranging for a professional massage, the Kona Kai Resort provides guests the opportunity to pursue life's pleasures." A guest review raves, calling the Kona Kai a "true San Diego experience", "a gorgeous place, from the lobby to the grounds, the pool and views", "very quiet" and "very comfortable", "fully loaded for the business traveler" and is also "a romantic spot for honeymooners". It is rated 3 1/2 stars by Hotels.com. Apparently my family and I stayed at an identically named "resort" located at the same street address in San Diego, but it obviously wasn't the same resort represented on Hotels.com. The lobby was spartan, but that was the least of our concerns. Upon entering the hallway to our room, it was obvious we were staying in a sub-standard motel that had no pretense of being a resort. Our room was not only dated, the last time it had been renovated was probably 20 years ago, but it had a strong mold and mildew odor. The air conditioner was antiquated and turning it on only added to the acrid odor. Cheap aluminum sliding doors lead to the courtyard-pool area, and the door looked as though it could be easily opened from the outside even when locked. The carpeting in the room had numerous stains on it and worst of all, the bed comforters were soiled, one with a large blood stain. The sheets were no better, having yellow stains on both beds. The bathroom was very small and looked as though it had received only a cursory cleaning subsequent to the previous guest and prior to our arrival. Plumbing fixtures were either rusty or calcified. Based on the room condition, we elected not to try the dining facilities at the "resort". We were traveling with other family members who stayed in another room in an adjacent building, and their room was equally appalling. The stairs leading to their room looked to be made of flimsy plywood that had been painted to conceal the deterioration. Carpets and bedding in their room were soiled as well. While their room did not have the same moldy odors as our room, the room was certainly not clean and inviting. Overall, this was the worst hotel/motel/resort experience I've had in many years of traveling. Before you book your room at the Kona Kai Resort, be sure to read ALL of the reveiws, and please disregard the Hotels.com ranking of the hotel unless you want an unpleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a stay at the Shelter Pointe--now under new management and known as the Kona Kai Resort. We had a wonderful stay. The room was clean with updated modern bedding and furnishings---sort of a subtle island resort theme. The beds were double sheeted--a nice touch, because who likes to touch hotel blankets?! We never heard any noise from adjacent rooms. The resort is situated in a beautiful location--Shelter Island. Both sides have views of yachting marinas. The pool area was beautiful---a good sized pool and hot tub, tons of nice cushy lounge chairs, etc...all with a view of the marina. I didn't have much interaction with the hotel staff, but the housekeeping was always thorough and timely. The location is also good...the island feels intimate, but you are very close to Point Loma and about a ten minute drive from downtown, the Gaslamp Quarter, Old Town, etc. Overall, I highly recommend this for couples and for families---a nice little playground on the premises and another just a short walk down the island.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: mikeyjgross
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a quick vacation swing through San Diego. The room was great, the staff was friendly and very helpful, and my wife and I both feel this is the most exquisuite location we've ever stayed at. The view of the marina from our room was just spectacular, and the pool and jacuzzi were wonderful. MY wife and I can't wait to plan another trip to this wonderful resort -- it is the highlight of our trip!

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE READ! Do NOT waste your $$ here!!”
Reviews.Author: Steelnation
Reviews.Content: What can I say, the stay was extremely disappointing from the minute we arrived, the worst hotel experience I have had in 30 years. First off they had us arriving in March, we reserved for February. Because of their mistake we were put in a bay view room with queen beds, we reserved a harbor view room with a king. The gentleman at the front desk offered to lower our rate for the trouble, yet he lowered it to the regular rate of the room we ended up in. Room service meal was awful, over priced drinks at the bar (AJ's). They charged the wrong credit card and finally - this is the loudest hotel I have ever stayed in in my life (I have traveled internationally for years). The walls are PAPER THIN and you can hear everything. We could hear people's full conversations in other rooms, heard hairdryers at 6 in the morning, could hear if some blew there nose for crying out loud. Save your money and take heed to this and the other negative reviews, as they are the TRUTH.
